author: _drinkcoffee
content:
> Will `eth_getStorageAt` always return a 32-byte value?  Does it even make sense to return a larger value?
<@!301186049323958275> Hyperledger Besu's implementation will return nothing or a 32 byte value. Have a look at: 
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/c2e4ae091bd835ae155e61b9daf1662549d3227a/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/query/BlockchainQueries.java#L131
and
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/master/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/jsonrpc/internal/methods/EthGetStorageAt.java

author: sky.cactus
content: Is it just me or is the Ethereum Wiki less accessible than the rest of Ethereum GitHub?  I cannot figure out a way to submit a pull request to the Wiki or make an edit.

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe I'm just blind and not seeing the button?

author: _drinkcoffee
content:
> Maybe I'm just blind and not seeing the button?
<@!301186049323958275> I am pretty sure I have seen this issue before: in github you can raise issues, do pull reqests etc on code, but not on the wiki. I think there is no button.

author: sky.cactus
content: Does anyone know what the process is for fixing something on the wiki then?

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> from ehat I remember it got disabled at some point - it was possible to edit it 2 yearsago but then no more

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> probably people were changing it without approval process
